tool.name: DIAlignR
tool.description: for retention time alignment of targeted mass spectrometric data
tool.command:
#import re
mkdir -p ./data/mzml && mkdir -p ./data/osw &&
#for $mzml in $input_mzml_files: #set $file_name_mzml = re.sub('[^\w\-_.]', '_', str($mzml.element_identifier)) echo '$file_name_mzml' >> ./runs.txt && ln -s '$mzml' './data/mzml/${file_name_mzml}.chrom.mzML' && #end for
#if $input_osw_file: ln -s '$input_osw_file' './data/osw/merged.osw' && #end if
Rscript --vanilla '${__tool_directory__}/dialignr.R' #if $input_osw_file: --oswMerged 'TRUE' #else: --oswMerged 'FALSE' #end if --maxFdrQuery '${$adv_params.maxFdrQuery}' --XICfilter '${$adv_params.XICfilter}' --polyOrd '${adv_params.polyOrd}' --kernelLen '${adv_params.kernelLen}' --globalAlignment '${adv_params.globalAlignment}' --globalAlignmentFdr '${adv_params.globalAlignmentFdr}' --globalAlignmentSpan '${adv_params.globalAlignmentSpan}' --RSEdistFactor '${adv_params.RSEdistFactor}' --normalization '${adv_params.normalization}' --simMeasure '${adv_params.simMeasure}' --alignType '${adv_params.alignType}' --goFactor '${adv_params.goFactor}' --geFactor '${adv_params.geFactor}' --cosAngleThresh '${adv_params.cosAngleThresh}' --OverlapAlignment '${adv_params.OverlapAlignment}' --dotProdThresh '${adv_params.dotProdThresh}' --gapQuantile '${adv_params.gapQuantile}' --hardConstrain '${adv_params.hardConstrain}' --samples4gradient '${adv_params.samples4gradient}' --analyteFDR '${adv_params.analyteFDR}' --unalignedFDR '${adv_params.unalignedFDR}' --alignedFDR '${adv_params.alignedFDR}' --baselineType '${adv_params.baselineType}' --integrationType '${adv_params.integrationType}' --fitEMG '${adv_params.fitEMG}' --recalIntensity '${adv_params.recalIntensity}' --fillMissing '${adv_params.fillMissing}' --smoothPeakArea '${adv_params.smoothPeakArea}' &&
cat alignedTargetedRuns.csv | sed 's/,/\t/g' > alignedTargetedRuns.tsv

param.name: input_mzml_files
param.label: MZML file(s)
param.help: Sample file(s) in .MZML format.

param.name: input_osw_file
param.label: OSW file
param.help: Sample file in .OSW format.

param.name: maxFdrQuery
param.label: Maximum FDR query
param.help: Numeric value between 0 and 1. It is used to filter features from osw file which have SCORE_MS2.QVALUE less than itself.

param.name: polyOrd
param.label: Order of the polynomial to be fit in the kernel

param.name: kernelLen
param.label: Number of data-points to consider in the kernel

param.name: globalAlignmentFdr
param.label: Global alignment FDR
param.help: Numeric value between 0 and 1. Features should have m-score lower than this value for participation in LOESS fit.

param.name: globalAlignmentSpan
param.label: Global alignment Span
param.help: Span value for LOESS fit. For targeted proteomics 0.1 could be used.

param.name: RSEdistFactor
param.label: RSE distance
param.help: Defines how much distance in the unit of rse remains a noBeef zone.

param.name: goFactor
param.label: Gap penalty (first gap)
param.help: Penalty for introducing first gap in alignment. This value is multiplied by base gap-penalty.

param.name: geFactor
param.label: Gap penalty (subsequent gaps)
param.help: Penalty for introducing subsequent gaps in alignment. This value is multiplied by base gap-penalty.

param.name: cosAngleThresh
param.label: cosAngleTresh
param.help: In SIM measure = dotProductMasked mode, angular similarity should be higher than cosAngleThresh otherwise similarity is forced to zero.

param.name: OverlapAlignment
param.label: Overlap alignment
param.help: An input for alignment with free end-gaps. No: Global alignment Yes: Overlap alignment

param.name: dotProdThresh
param.label: dotProdThresh
param.help: In SIM measure = dotProductMasked mode, values in similarity matrix higher than dotProdThresh quantile are checked for angular similarity.

param.name: gapQuantile
param.label: Gap quantile
param.help: Must be between 0 and 1. This is used to calculate base gap-penalty from similarity distribution.

param.name: hardConstrain
param.label: Hard constrain
param.help: No: Indices farther from noBeef distance are filled with distance from linear fit line.

param.name: samples4gradient
param.label: Samples for gradient
param.help: Modulates penalization of masked indices.

param.name: analyteFDR
param.label: Analyte FDR
param.help: Defines the upper limit of FDR on a precursor to be considered for multipeptide.

param.name: unalignedFDR
param.label: Unaligned FDR
param.help: Must be between 0 and maxFdrQuery. Features below unalignedFDR are considered for quantification even without the RT alignment.

param.name: alignedFDR
param.label: Aligned FDR
param.help: Must be between unalignedFDR and 1. Features below alignedFDRare considered for quantification after the alignment.

param.name: baselineType
param.label: Baseline method
param.help: Method to estimate the background of a peak contained in XICs.

param.name: integrationType
param.label: Integration method
param.help: Method to compute the area of a peak contained in XICs.

param.name: fitEMG
param.label: Fit EMG
param.help: Enable/disable exponentially modified gaussian peak model fitting.

param.name: recalIntensity
param.label: Recal intensity
param.help: Recalculate intensity for all analytes.

param.name: fillMissing
param.label: Fill missing
param.help: Calculate intensity for analytes for which features are not found.

param.name: smoothPeakArea
param.label: Smooth peak area
param.help: No: Raw chromatograms will be used for quantification. Yes: Smoothed chromatograms will be used for quantification.

tool.help:
DIAlignR =============
DIAlignR is an R package for retention time alignment of targeted mass spectrometric data, including DIA and SWATH-MS data. This tool works with MS2 chromatograms directly and uses dynamic programming for alignment of raw chromatographic traces. DIAlignR uses a hybrid approach of global (feature-based) and local (raw data-based) alignment to establish correspondence between peaks.
For more information see the DIAlignR documentation_.
.. _documentation: https://github.com/shubham1637/DIAlignR
